member.name: T:KiteConnect.Kite
member.summary: The API client class. In production, you may initialize a single instance of this class per `APIKey`.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Net.WebProxy,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize a new Kite Connect client instance.
member.param: API Key issued to you

The token obtained after the login flow in exchange for the `RequestToken` . Pre-login, this will default to None,but once you have obtained it, you should persist it in a database or session to pass to the Kite Connect class initialisation for subsequent requests.
API end point root. Unless you explicitly want to send API requests to a non-default endpoint, this can be ignored.
If set to True, will serialise and print requests and responses to stdout.
Time in milliseconds for which the API client will wait for a request to complete before it fails
To set proxy for http request. Should be an object of WebProxy.
Number of connections to server. Client will reuse the connections if they are alive.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.EnableLogging(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enabling logging prints HTTP request and response summaries to console
member.param: Set to true to enable logging

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.SetSessionExpiryHook(System.Action)
member.summary: Set a callback hook for session (`TokenException` -- timeout, expiry etc.) errors. An `AccessToken` (login session) can become invalid for a number of reasons, but it doesn't make sense for the client to try and catch it during every API call. A callback method that handles session errors can be set here and when the client encounters a token error at any point, it'll be called. This callback, for instance, can log the user out of the UI, clear session cookies, or initiate a fresh login.
member.param: Action to be invoked when session becomes invalid.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.SetAccessToken(System.String)
member.summary: Set the `AccessToken` received after a successful authentication.
member.param: Access token for the session.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetLoginURL
member.summary: Get the remote login url to which a user should be redirected to initiate the login flow.
member.returns: Login url to authenticate the user.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GenerateSession(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Do the token exchange with the `RequestToken` obtained after the login flow, and retrieve the `AccessToken` required for all subsequent requests.The response contains not just the `AccessToken`, but metadata for the user who has authenticated.
member.param: Token obtained from the GET paramers after a successful login redirect.
API secret issued with the API key.
member.returns: User structure with tokens and profile data

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.InvalidateAccessToken(System.String)
member.summary: Kill the session by invalidating the access token
member.param: Access token to invalidate. Default is the active access token.
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.InvalidateRefreshToken(System.String)
member.param: RefreshToken to invalidate
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.RenewAccessToken(System.String,System.String)
member.param: RefreshToken to renew the AccessToken.
API secret issued with the API key.
member.returns: TokenRenewResponse that contains new AccessToken and RefreshToken.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetProfile
member.summary: Gets currently logged in user details

member.summary: A virtual contract provides detailed charges order-wise for brokerage, STT, stamp duty, exchange transaction charges, SEBI turnover charge, and GST.
member.param: List of all order params to get contract notes for
member.returns: List of contract notes for the params

member.summary: Margin data for a specific order
member.param: List of all order params to get margins for
Mode of the returned response content. Eg: Constants.MARGIN_MODE_COMPACT

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetBasketMargins(System.Collections.Generic.List{KiteConnect.OrderMarginParams},System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Margin data for a basket orders
member.param: List of all order params to get margins for
Consider users positions while calculating margins
Mode of the returned response content. Eg: Constants.MARGIN_MODE_COMPACT

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetMargins
member.summary: Get account balance and cash margin details for all segments.
member.returns: User margin response with both equity and commodity margins.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetMargins(System.String)
member.summary: Get account balance and cash margin details for a particular segment.
member.param: Trading segment (eg: equity or commodity)
Name of the exchange
Tradingsymbol of the instrument
BUY or SELL
Quantity to transact
For LIMIT orders
Margin product applied to the order (margin is blocked based on this)
Order type (MARKET, LIMIT etc.)
Order validity (DAY, IOC and TTL)
Quantity to disclose publicly (for equity trades)
For SL, SL-M etc.
Price difference at which the order should be squared off and profit booked (eg: Order price is 100. Profit target is 102. So squareoff = 2)
Stoploss difference at which the order should be squared off (eg: Order price is 100. Stoploss target is 98. So stoploss = 2)
Incremental value by which stoploss price changes when market moves in your favor by the same incremental value from the entry price (optional)
You can place orders of varieties; regular orders, after market orders, cover orders, iceberg orders etc.
An optional tag to apply to an order to identify it (alphanumeric, max 20 chars)
Order life span in minutes for TTL validity orders
Total number of legs for iceberg order type (number of legs per Iceberg should be between 2 and 10)
Split quantity for each iceberg leg order (Quantity/IcebergLegs)
member.returns: Json response in the form of nested string dictionary.

For SL, SL-M etc.
You can place orders of varieties; regular orders, after market orders, cover orders etc.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetOrderTrades(System.String)
member.summary: Retreive the list of trades executed (all or ones under a particular order). An order can be executed in tranches based on market conditions. These trades are individually recorded under an order.
member.param: is the ID of the order (optional) whose trades are to be retrieved. If no `OrderId` is specified, all trades for the day are returned.
member.returns: List of trades of given order.

Tradingsymbol of the instrument
BUY or SELL
overnight or day
Quantity to convert

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetInstruments(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve the list of market instruments available to trade. Note that the results could be large, several hundred KBs in size, with tens of thousands of entries in the list.
member.param: Name of the exchange

member.summary: Retrieve quote and market depth of upto 200 instruments
member.param: Indentification of instrument in the form of EXCHANGE:TRADINGSYMBOL (eg: NSE:INFY) or InstrumentToken (eg: 408065)
member.returns: Dictionary of all Quote objects with keys as in InstrumentId

member.summary: Retrieve LTP and OHLC of upto 200 instruments

member.returns: Dictionary with InstrumentId as key and LTP as value.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetHistoricalData(System.String,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieve historical data (candles) for an instrument.
member.param: Identifier for the instrument whose historical records you want to fetch. This is obtained with the instrument list API.
Date in format yyyy-MM-dd for fetching candles between two days. Date in format yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss for fetching candles between two timestamps.
Date in format yyyy-MM-dd for fetching candles between two days. Date in format yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss for fetching candles between two timestamps.
The candle record interval. Possible values are: minute, day, 3minute, 5minute, 10minute, 15minute, 30minute, 60minute
Pass true to get continous data of expired instruments.
Pass true to get open interest data.

BUY or SELL
member.returns: List of trigger ranges for given instrument ids for given transaction type.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.PlaceMFOrder(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.String)
member.returns: JSON response as nested string dictionary.
member.param: Tradingsymbol (ISIN) of the fund.
BUY or SELL.
Amount worth of units to purchase. Not applicable on SELLs.
Quantity to SELL. Not applicable on BUYs. If the holding is less than minimum_redemption_quantity, all the units have to be sold.
An optional tag to apply to an order to identify it (alphanumeric, max 8 chars).

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.CancelMFOrder(System.String)
member.returns: JSON response as nested string dictionary.
member.param: Unique order id.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetMFSIPs
member.returns: The list of all Mutual funds SIPs.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetMFSIPs(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a single Mutual funds SIP by SIP id.
member.param: SIP id.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.PlaceMFSIP(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Places a Mutual funds SIP order.
member.returns: JSON response as nested string dictionary.
member.param: ISIN of the fund.
Amount worth of units to purchase. It should be equal to or greated than minimum_additional_purchase_amount and in multiple of purchase_amount_multiplier in the instrument master.

Amount worth of units to purchase before the SIP starts. Should be equal to or greater than minimum_purchase_amount and in multiple of purchase_amount_multiplier. This is only considered if there have been no prior investments in the target fund.
weekly, monthly, or quarterly.
If Frequency is monthly, the day of the month (1, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25) to trigger the order on.
Number of instalments to trigger. If set to -1, instalments are triggered at fixed intervals until the SIP is cancelled.
An optional tag to apply to an order to identify it (alphanumeric, max 8 chars).

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.ModifyMFSIP(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.returns: JSON response as nested string dictionary.
member.param: SIP id.
Amount worth of units to purchase. It should be equal to or greated than minimum_additional_purchase_amount and in multiple of purchase_amount_multiplier in the instrument master.
weekly, monthly, or quarterly.
If Frequency is monthly, the day of the month (1, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25) to trigger the order on.
Number of instalments to trigger. If set to -1, instalments are triggered idefinitely until the SIP is cancelled.
Pause or unpause an SIP (active or paused).

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.CancelMFSIP(System.String)
member.returns: JSON response as nested string dictionary.
member.param: SIP id.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Kite.GetMFHoldings
member.returns: The list of all Mutual funds holdings.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Ticker.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,KiteConnect.IWebSocket)
member.param: API key issued to you
Zerodha client id of the authenticated user

Token obtained after the login flow in exchange for the `request_token`.Pre-login, this will default to None, but once you have obtained it, you should persist it in a database or session to pass to the Kite Connect class initialisation for subsequent requests.
Websocket API end point root. Unless you explicitly want to send API requests to a non-default endpoint, this can be ignored.
Enables WebSocket autreconnect in case of network failure/disconnection.
Interval (in seconds) between auto reconnection attemptes. Defaults to 5 seconds.
Maximum number reconnection attempts. Defaults to 50 attempts.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Ticker.ReSubscribe
member.summary: Resubscribe to all currently subscribed tokens. Used to restore all the subscribed tokens after successful reconnection.

member.name: M:KiteConnect.Ticker.EnableReconnect(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Enable WebSocket autreconnect in case of network failure/disconnection.
member.param: Interval between auto reconnection attemptes. `onReconnect` callback is triggered when reconnection is attempted.
Maximum number reconnection attempts. Defaults to 50 attempts. `onNoReconnect` callback is triggered when number of retries exceeds this value.
